optic_ratings.justification: The project status report indicates that the 'DAF / GIP or one pager' is not mentioned to be prepared and there is no clear evidence of internal approvals from all impacted portfolios. Additionally, the start date of the IT effort is not explicitly known. These conditions match the 'RED' criteria for firmness_of_opportunity.

The project status report does not provide any direct evidence of L1 and/or L2 benefits being defined with agreed benefit owners. It also doesn't indicate that there is an ongoing benefits case in progress or needs revisiting. Thus, according to the business_case criteria, the project status aligns with 'RED' as there is no mention of a developed benefits case or validation of existing benefits.

The project status report lacks any direct mention of clearly defined and documented requirements for impacted portfolios, such as a Charter. The absence of such evidence suggests that requirements are inadequately defined, meeting the 'RED' criteria for business_requirements.

The Executive Summary mentions that 'Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept' and 'Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo.' However, there is a challenge with 'Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live,' which suggests additional time/work is needed to define or finalize agreement aspects of the solution. This aligns with the 'AMBER' criteria, indicating additional work is needed for defining the solution.

The project status report does not provide explicit information about capacity or scope-based estimates with defined levels of confidence. There is no mention of budget estimates or a confidence level in the report. This uncertainty aligns most closely with the 'RED' criteria, which involve planning numbers based on little science with +/- 50% level of confidence.

There is no direct evidence in the 'Project Status Report' indicating a need for additional staff or lack of required skills and capabilities. The report states, 'Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept' and 'Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo,' which suggests that existing staff can deliver all necessary work. Hence, it aligns with the 'GREEN' criteria for commercialops_functions_support​.

The project status report contains discussions on the internal model being discussed with the IT Management, although there is no explicit confirmation of resource commitments. The statement 'Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.' from the Executive Summary suggests a request has been made, but firm commitments have not been finalized, matching the 'AMBER' criteria.

The report mentions 'Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept' without indicating any specific need for additional staff or a lack of required skills or capabilities. There is no direct mention of requests for additional resources or the prioritization issues that might necessitate more staffing. Thus, it aligns with the 'GREEN' criteria that existing staff can deliver the work.

There is no direct evidence in the 'Project Status Report' indicating a request for additional resources or lack of required skills/capabilities. The Executive Summary notes 'Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept,' suggesting that existing staff can deliver the work required. This aligns with the 'GREEN' criteria for owning_portfolio_it_resource_capacity​.

The Executive Summary states, 'Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.' This indicates that the solution will require amendments to an existing support model as it is still under discussion and pending final approval. This aligns with the 'AMBER' criteria where amendments to an existing support contract are necessary.

The Executive Summary notes that the 'Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.' This implies that a governance model is drafted but not yet fully agreed, thus matching the 'AMBER' criteria.

The project status report does not provide any direct evidence of a strong working relationship between the Business and IT teams, nor is there any mention of past collaborations or a current relationship status. Therefore, according to the partnership_and_collaboration criteria, the situation aligns with 'RED' as there is no evidence of experience or a healthy working relationship between the teams.

tasks_output.description:
Analyze the Project Status Report for project 'Downstream Exchange Product (DSX) (PRJ0016435)'  and evaluate its risk for the optic **firmness_of_opportunity**. **CRITERIA FOR firmness_of_opportunity:**
        - GREEN: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' prepared and all internal approvals obtained from all impacted portfolios. Start date of IT effort known
        - AMBER: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' in progress. Impacted portfolio approvals expected within 2 months. Tentative start date of IT effort known
        - RED: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' not yet prepared. Approvals not expected for >3 months. Start date of IT effort unknown

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

Analyze the Project Status Report for project 'Downstream Exchange Product (DSX) (PRJ0016435)'  and evaluate its risk for the optic **solution​**. **CRITERIA FOR solution​:**

        - AMBER: Additional time/work needed to define solution​​
        - RED: Solution not yet understood​

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

The project status report does not provide any direct evidence of L1 and/or L2 benefits being defined with agreed benefit owners. It also doesn't indicate that there is an ongoing benefits case in progress or needs revisiting. Thus, according to the business_case criteria, the project status aligns with 'RED' as there is no mention of a developed benefits case or validation of existing benefits.

The project status report lacks any direct mention of clearly defined and documented requirements for impacted portfolios, such as a Charter. The absence of such evidence suggests that requirements are inadequately defined, meeting the 'RED' criteria for business_requirements.

The Executive Summary mentions that 'Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept' and 'Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo.' However, there is a challenge with 'Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live,' which suggests additional time/work is needed to define or finalize agreement aspects of the solution. This aligns with the 'AMBER' criteria, indicating additional work is needed for defining the solution.

The project status report does not provide explicit information about capacity or scope-based estimates with defined levels of confidence. There is no mention of budget estimates or a confidence level in the report. This uncertainty aligns most closely with the 'RED' criteria, which involve planning numbers based on little science with +/- 50% level of confidence.

There is no direct evidence in the 'Project Status Report' indicating a need for additional staff or lack of required skills and capabilities. The report states, 'Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept' and 'Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo,' which suggests that existing staff can deliver all necessary work. Hence, it aligns with the 'GREEN' criteria for commercialops_functions_support​.

The project status report contains discussions on the internal model being discussed with the IT Management, although there is no explicit confirmation of resource commitments. The statement 'Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.' from the Executive Summary suggests a request has been made, but firm commitments have not been finalized, matching the 'AMBER' criteria.

The report mentions 'Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept' without indicating any specific need for additional staff or a lack of required skills or capabilities. There is no direct mention of requests for additional resources or the prioritization issues that might necessitate more staffing. Thus, it aligns with the 'GREEN' criteria that existing staff can deliver the work.

There is no direct evidence in the 'Project Status Report' indicating a request for additional resources or lack of required skills/capabilities. The Executive Summary notes 'Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept,' suggesting that existing staff can deliver the work required. This aligns with the 'GREEN' criteria for owning_portfolio_it_resource_capacity​.

The Executive Summary states, 'Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.' This indicates that the solution will require amendments to an existing support model as it is still under discussion and pending final approval. This aligns with the 'AMBER' criteria where amendments to an existing support contract are necessary.

The Executive Summary notes that the 'Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.' This implies that a governance model is drafted but not yet fully agreed, thus matching the 'AMBER' criteria.

The project status report does not provide any direct evidence of a strong working relationship between the Business and IT teams, nor is there any mention of past collaborations or a current relationship status. Therefore, according to the partnership_and_collaboration criteria, the situation aligns with 'RED' as there is no evidence of experience or a healthy working relationship between the teams.

tasks_output.summary: Review all the individual optic ratings provided by your team...

optic_ratings.justification: The project status report does not mention a DAF / GIP or 'one pager' being prepared or in progress. There is also no information provided about internal approvals being obtained or expected. Furthermore, the start date of the IT effort is not known as it is not mentioned in the report. Hence the rating is Red as per the criteria.

The project status report does not provide any direct evidence or mention of L1 and/or L2 benefits being defined or having agreed benefit owners. There is also no indication of a benefits case in progress or needing revisiting. Therefore, the rating is Red as per the criteria because no benefits case has been developed or existing benefits are invalid.

The project status report does not provide clear evidence of requirements for impacted portfolios being clearly defined and documented. There is no mention of a Charter or equivalent documentation that indicates readiness to mobilize. Additionally, there is reference to challenges such as Market Data Agreements not being agreed upon, which suggests inadequately defined requirements. The justification aligns with the criteria for a 'Red' rating.

The project status report references unresolved issues with Market Data Agreements in the COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE section: 'Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept.' This unresolved issue indicates that the solution is not yet understood and has not been fully defined, aligning with the 'Red' rating criteria.

The project status report does not provide any direct evidence or information on budget estimates or their accuracy levels. There is no mention of Confidence Levels, Capacity, or Scope-based estimate data that matches the criteria for Green or Amber ratings. Hence the rating is Red as per the criteria: Planning number based on little science with +/- 50% level of confidence​.

The project status report details multiple successful deployments and achievements by the existing teams, such as the DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 deployments and capability proving exercises, which were accomplished without any mention of needing additional staff or skills. This suggests that the existing staff can deliver all necessary work, hence matching the criteria for a GREEN rating.

There is no evidence in the project status report of concrete resource commitments having been obtained (which is required for a Green rating). However, there is also no indication that resource requests have been made without resources available or lacking the required skills (which would merit a Red rating). The discussion with IT Management about the Internal model is ongoing, which suggests that requests have been made but no firm commitments have been reached yet. Therefore, the rating is 'Amber' as per the criteria.

The project status report describes multiple achievements and ongoing plans indicating existing staff's capability to deliver the work. For instance, the successful deployment of releases and exercises like the DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 deployments, and the Disaster Recovery capability proving exercise, suggest that current staffing and capabilities are sufficient to meet project requirements. There is no mention of the need for additional staff or any resource-based impediments. Thus, this aligns with the criteria for a GREEN rating.

The project status report does not indicate a need for additional staff or prioritization calls. There are successful achievements and upcoming activities without any mention of resource constraints or lack of required skills. Therefore, the existing staff appears capable of delivering the work, matching the criteria for a GREEN rating.

The project status report mentions 'Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.' This indicates that the support model is still under discussion and has not been clearly defined or finalized. This aligns with the 'Red' rating criteria, which state that the support model is unclear.

The project status report does not mention a governance model being defined, drafted, or agreed upon. There is no information on a decision owner being identified. Hence, the rating is Red as per the criteria: Governance model not yet drafted.

The project status report does not provide explicit evidence of either a robust existing relationship or significant challenges between Business and IT teams. However, it indicates that there is ongoing collaboration on aspects like 'Internal model being discussed with the IT Management' and 'Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange'. These elements suggest some level of ongoing interaction and previous collaboration, but the need for coordination meetings implies there might be room for improving the relationship. Thus, the rating is 'Amber' as per the criteria.

tasks_output.agent: Chief Risk Assessment Officer

optic_ratings.justification: The justification is based on several indications: While a 'one pager' is still in draft as indicated by 'GIP in draft' and 'GIP approval likely to go into Aug '25', approvals are expected within the near future as the progress on GIP is ongoing with a planned alignment with business stakeholders. However, the exact start date of the IT effort isn't explicitly provided, leading to a tentative understanding that activities have timelines extending around end of September and decisions expected end of August. Thus, aligning more with the Amber criteria: 'DAF / GIP or 'one pager' in progress. Impacted portfolio approvals expected within 2 months. Tentative start date of IT effort known.'

The justification is based on the statement: 'Value (AMBER): GIP is in draft, IT costs and plans developed, business still refining the actual value case, one month behind plan. RTG: Plan to complete and sign-off GIP by end of Aug, aligned with key business stakeholders.' This indicates that while business value is being considered, it is still in the process of refinement, which fits the criteria for 'Amber: Benefits case in progress / needs revisiting'. Additionally, there is a reduction from the originally expected benefits as confirmed in the general comments: '31 m$/ year level 1/level 2 Europe benefits were confirmed, down from 55 m$/year', suggesting revision is necessary.

The project status report indicates that there are ongoing aspects that suggest incomplete requirements gathering: 'Negotiations with Kinaxis on licenses is near completion, work is in progress on the timeline and cost for the blueprinting, design & detailed planning phase.' Additionally, 'IDT Cost estimates are drafted and being reviewed,' along with 'GIP (Group Investment Proposal) is in draft,' further implies additional work needed to define and confirm requirements. These suggest that additional requirements gathering is needed, which aligns with the Amber criteria of 'Additional requirements gathering needed in some portfolios in order to formally mobilize.'

The justification is based on several elements in the Project Status Report. The section under 'Challenges & RTG' mentions that 'Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept.' This indicates that additional work is needed to finalize agreements critical for implementation, reflecting that the solution is not fully defined yet. While some technical and functional readiness is indicated, the dependency on market data agreements showcases the need for additional work, aligning the project with the 'Amber' criterion: 'Additional time/work needed to define solution​​.'

The project status report mentions 'Cost (RED): $750k budget approved through to the end of July has been spent. RTG: Sandeep to request bridge funding of $250k cover until end of Sep'25 and GIP approval.' This implies the budget is not firmly based as additional bridge funding is needed, which aligns with the Red criteria: 'Planning number based on little science with +/- 50% level of confidence'. There is no explicit evidence of a capacity or scope-based estimate in place with any given level of confidence.

The Executive Summary highlights that the 'Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus,' indicating a possible shortfall in staffing or prioritization challenges. Additionally, the Comments on Schedule reflects a (Red) Schedule status, which may indirectly suggest resource allocation issues. Thus, aligning the current situation with the 'Amber' criteria where 'Additional staff needed in some teams and/or a prioritisation call is needed​​.' No direct mention of inadequate skills or severe staff shortages was found for a 'Red' rating, nor does the report suggest existing staff can handle everything without potential issues, which would qualify as 'Green.'

There are discussions on global support models and resource-related negotiations with Kinaxis, but no firm commitments on resources for the IT aspect have been clearly stated. This aligns with the Amber criteria: 'Request made, no firm commitments made​​.'

tasks_output.description:
Analyze the Project Status Report for project '2025 Planning and Scheduling IDT Work (PRJ4897790)'  and evaluate its risk for the optic **firmness_of_opportunity**. **CRITERIA FOR firmness_of_opportunity:**
        - GREEN: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' prepared and all internal approvals obtained from all impacted portfolios. Start date of IT effort known
        - AMBER: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' in progress. Impacted portfolio approvals expected within 2 months. Tentative start date of IT effort known
        - RED: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' not yet prepared. Approvals not expected for >3 months. Start date of IT effort unknown

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

        - GREEN: Ready to mobilize - requirements for impacted portfolios are clearly defined and documented, e.g. in a Charter​​
        - AMBER: Additional requirements gathering needed in some portfolios in order to formally mobilize​​
        - RED: Inadequately defined requirements. 

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

Analyze the Project Status Report for project '2025 Planning and Scheduling IDT Work (PRJ4897790)'  and evaluate its risk for the optic **ts_and_broader_rds_it_resource_Capacity**. **CRITERIA FOR ts_and_broader_rds_it_resource_Capacity:**
        - GREEN: Resource discussion taken place and commitments obtained​​
        - AMBER: Request made, no firm commitments made​​
        - RED: Request made and no resources available and/or lack of required skills/capabilities ​​

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

--- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Negotiations with Kinaxis on licenses is near completion, work is in progress on the timeline and cost for the blueprinting, design & detailed planning phase.IDT & Business cost estimates have been completed for the GIP. IDT detailed design work on integration between Planning & Scheduling and source systems (GSAP, DEX, etc.) is on track. planned to complete end of Sep'25.​ Challenges & RTG Plans: Schedule (AMBER): DRB has asked to target end of July for GIP signoff, so that the contract with Kinaxis could be signed ASAP. GIP has been delayed by one month, revised date is now end of Aug. RTG: Planned dates are aligned with business stakeholders. Final signature is with Richard Jory.Cost (RED): $750k budget approved through to the end of July has been spent. RTG: Sandeep to request bridge funding of $250k cover until end of Sep'25 and GIP approval.Value (AMBER): GIP is in draft, IT costs and plans developed, busffiness still refining the actual value case, one month behind plan. RTG: Plan to complete and sign-off GIP by end of Aug, aligned with key business stakeholders.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: DRB has asked to target end of July for GIP signoff, so that the contract with Kinaxis could be signed ASAP. GIP has been delayed by one month, revised date is now end of Aug. RTG: Planned dates are aligned with business stakeholders. Final signature is with Richard Jory.

--- COMMENTS ON COST ---
Comments on Cost: $750k budget approved through to the end of July has been spent. RTG: Sandeep to request bridge funding of $250k cover until end of Sep'25 and GIP approval.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: Progress & Success: Negotiations with Kinaxis: DRB confirmed walk-away points. Negotiations ongoing and expected to complete by end of July.Progress: IDT Cost estimates are drafted and being reviewed by the IT LTs, planned to complete by end of 18th July. IDT detailed design work on integration between Planning & Scheduling and source systems (GSAP, DEX, etc.) is on track. planned to complete end of Sep'25.​ Challenges & RTG Plans: Schedule (AMBER): DRB has asked to target end of July for GIP signoff. This target date is at risk, because the commercial negotiation is taking longer than anticipated and GIP approval likely to go into Aug '25 as it needs Andrew Smith's approval.Cost (RED): $750k funding approved for the first 7 months of 2025 but initial stage will continue to the end of Q3, RTG: Sandeep to provide additional budget $250k cover until end of Sep'25 and GIP approval.Value (AMBER): 31 m$ / year level 1/level 2 Europe benefits were confirmed, down from 55 m$/year. RTG: Group Investment Proposal (GIP) to be developed and signed-off as soon as possible based on Europe business case

This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

optic_ratings.justification: The justification is based on several indications: While a 'one pager' is still in draft as indicated by 'GIP in draft' and 'GIP approval likely to go into Aug '25', approvals are expected within the near future as the progress on GIP is ongoing with a planned alignment with business stakeholders. However, the exact start date of the IT effort isn't explicitly provided, leading to a tentative understanding that activities have timelines extending around end of September and decisions expected end of August. Thus, aligning more with the Amber criteria: 'DAF / GIP or 'one pager' in progress. Impacted portfolio approvals expected within 2 months. Tentative start date of IT effort known.'

The justification is based on the statement: 'Value (AMBER): GIP is in draft, IT costs and plans developed, business still refining the actual value case, one month behind plan. RTG: Plan to complete and sign-off GIP by end of Aug, aligned with key business stakeholders.' This indicates that while business value is being considered, it is still in the process of refinement, which fits the criteria for 'Amber: Benefits case in progress / needs revisiting'. Additionally, there is a reduction from the originally expected benefits as confirmed in the general comments: '31 m$/ year level 1/level 2 Europe benefits were confirmed, down from 55 m$/year', suggesting revision is necessary.

The project status report indicates that there are ongoing aspects that suggest incomplete requirements gathering: 'Negotiations with Kinaxis on licenses is near completion, work is in progress on the timeline and cost for the blueprinting, design & detailed planning phase.' Additionally, 'IDT Cost estimates are drafted and being reviewed,' along with 'GIP (Group Investment Proposal) is in draft,' further implies additional work needed to define and confirm requirements. These suggest that additional requirements gathering is needed, which aligns with the Amber criteria of 'Additional requirements gathering needed in some portfolios in order to formally mobilize.'

The justification is based on several elements in the Project Status Report. The section under 'Challenges & RTG' mentions that 'Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept.' This indicates that additional work is needed to finalize agreements critical for implementation, reflecting that the solution is not fully defined yet. While some technical and functional readiness is indicated, the dependency on market data agreements showcases the need for additional work, aligning the project with the 'Amber' criterion: 'Additional time/work needed to define solution​​.'

The project status report mentions 'Cost (RED): $750k budget approved through to the end of July has been spent. RTG: Sandeep to request bridge funding of $250k cover until end of Sep'25 and GIP approval.' This implies the budget is not firmly based as additional bridge funding is needed, which aligns with the Red criteria: 'Planning number based on little science with +/- 50% level of confidence'. There is no explicit evidence of a capacity or scope-based estimate in place with any given level of confidence.

The Executive Summary highlights that the 'Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus,' indicating a possible shortfall in staffing or prioritization challenges. Additionally, the Comments on Schedule reflects a (Red) Schedule status, which may indirectly suggest resource allocation issues. Thus, aligning the current situation with the 'Amber' criteria where 'Additional staff needed in some teams and/or a prioritisation call is needed​​.' No direct mention of inadequate skills or severe staff shortages was found for a 'Red' rating, nor does the report suggest existing staff can handle everything without potential issues, which would qualify as 'Green.'

There are discussions on global support models and resource-related negotiations with Kinaxis, but no firm commitments on resources for the IT aspect have been clearly stated. This aligns with the Amber criteria: 'Request made, no firm commitments made​​.'

The project status report does not indicate any need for additional staff or a prioritization call. There is no mention of resource requests or skills shortages that have not been fulfilled, thus aligning with the criteria for Green: 'Existing staff can deliver the work​​.'

The project status report does not indicate any resource or skill shortages. There are no statements indicating a need for additional staff or resource requests that have not been fulfilled, thus aligning with the criteria for Green: 'Existing staff can deliver the work​​.'
The direct quote from the text that proves your rating. If no direct evidence exists, the say don't have the data to provide.'

The internal governance model is currently being discussed with IT Management, but it is not finalized as the final step is to seek approval from Owen O'Connell in September, as mentioned in the Executive Summary: 'Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.' This aligns with the Amber criteria where the governance model is drafted but not yet fully agreed.

tasks_output.description:
Analyze the Project Status Report for project '2025 HVO B7 - LCF IDT (PRJ4872962)'  and evaluate its risk for the optic **firmness_of_opportunity**. **CRITERIA FOR firmness_of_opportunity:**
        - GREEN: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' prepared and all internal approvals obtained from all impacted portfolios. Start date of IT effort known
        - AMBER: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' in progress. Impacted portfolio approvals expected within 2 months. Tentative start date of IT effort known
        - RED: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' not yet prepared. Approvals not expected for >3 months. Start date of IT effort unknown

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. --- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---

Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

tasks_output.description:
Analyze the Project Status Report for project '2025 HVO B7 - LCF IDT (PRJ4872962)'  and evaluate its risk for the optic **owning_portfolio_it_resource_capacity​**. **CRITERIA FOR owning_portfolio_it_resource_capacity​:**
        - GREEN: Existing staff can deliver the work​​​
        - AMBER: Additional staff needed and/or a prioritisation call is needed​​
        - RED: Request made and no resources available and/or lack of required skills/capabilities ​​

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

tasks_output.description:
Analyze the Project Status Report for project '2025 HVO B7 - LCF IDT (PRJ4872962)'  and evaluate its risk for the optic **effective_governance​**. **CRITERIA FOR effective_governance​:**
        - GREEN: Governance model defined and agreed across IT and Business stakeholders -AND- fully addresses the project scope and risk -AND-clear decision owner identified​
        - AMBER: Governance model drafted but not yet fully agreed -OR- drafted but does not match the project scope and risk​​​
        - RED: Governance model not yet drafted

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

tasks_output.description:
Analyze the Project Status Report for project 'Downstream Exchange Product (DSX) (PRJ0016435)'  and evaluate its risk for the optic **firmness_of_opportunity**. **CRITERIA FOR firmness_of_opportunity:**
        - GREEN: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' prepared and all internal approvals obtained from all impacted portfolios. Start date of IT effort known
        - AMBER: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' in progress. Impacted portfolio approvals expected within 2 months. Tentative start date of IT effort known
        - RED: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' not yet prepared. Approvals not expected for >3 months. Start date of IT effort unknown

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

Analyze the Project Status Report for project 'Downstream Exchange Product (DSX) (PRJ0016435)'  and evaluate its risk for the optic **commercialops_functions_support​**. **CRITERIA FOR commercialops_functions_support​:**
        - GREEN: Existing staff can deliver the all necessary work​​
        - AMBER: Additional staff needed in some teams and/or a prioritisation call is needed​​
        - RED: Lack of required skills and capabilities​​

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.
