        - AMBER: Benefits case in progress / needs revisiting​
        - RED: No Benefits case developed / existing benefits no longer valid​

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

        - AMBER: Additional time/work needed to define solution​​

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

optic_ratings.justification: The executive summary notes that 'IDT & Business cost estimates have been completed for the GIP,' and 'GIP is in draft, IT costs and plans developed, busffiness still refining the actual value case, one month behind plan.' The 'COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE' section indicates 'GIP has been delayed by one month, revised date is now end of Aug,' showing that the GIP is in progress with impacted portfolio approvals expected within 2 months. This corresponds to the Amber criteria, where the DAF/GIP is in progress with approvals anticipated within a specific timeframe.

The executive summary indicates: 'Value (AMBER): GIP is in draft, IT costs and plans developed, business still refining the actual value case, one month behind plan.' Additionally, the general comments also state that '31 m$ / year level 1/level 2 Europe benefits were confirmed, down from 55 m$/year.' This shows that the benefits case is in progress but needs revisiting, which falls under the Amber criteria.

The project status report lacks detailed information on specific requirements for impacted portfolios. There is no mention of a Charter or equivalent document defining and documenting the business requirements clearly. This indicates that requirements are inadequately defined, matching the criteria for a Red rating.

The EXECUTIVE SUMMARY expresses potential issues with 'Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live.' The schedule comments also mention this risk, stating the need for agreement by end of Aug to maintain the timeline, indicating that while parts of the solution related to 'Externalisation' are in progress, there is still a need for additional work to ensure feasibility before deployment. This matches the Amber criteria, where additional time/work is needed to define the solution.

The project status report under 'EXECUTIVE SUMMARY' reflects a 'Cost (RED): $750k budget approved through to the end of July has been spent.' and mentions a request for additional funding: 'Sandeep to request bridge funding of $250k cover until end of Sep'​25 and GIP approval.' The 'COMMENTS ON COST' section reiterates the consumption of the $750k budget and highlights the necessity to secure additional budget. These factors indicate significant budget uncertainty, aligning with the criteria for a Red rating: 'Planning number based on little science with +/- 50% level of confidence.'

The project status report does not explicitly mention the need for additional staff or a lack of required skills and capabilities related to commercialops_functions_support. The completion of technical and functional readiness as mentioned in 'EXECUTIVE SUMMARY' point to existing staff being sufficient for ongoing project needs. Therefore, the GREEN criteria is met, as there is no evidence to suggest that additional staff or prioritization is required.

There is no specific mention of resource commitments being obtained in the EXECUTIVE SUMMARY or other sections. However, the overall context suggests progress in various activities, including 'internal model being discussed with the IT Management,' which indicates that resource requests have been made but no firm commitments have been documented. This aligns with the Amber criteria: 'Request made, no firm commitments made.'

The project status report does not mention any specific need for additional staff or a lack of required skills and capabilities related to ts_process_team_within_comm_ops_bia_org.​ The accomplishments and planning sections illustrate ongoing technical readiness and deployment activities being successfully completed without indicating resource constraints. Therefore, the GREEN criteria are met, as existing staff can deliver the work without requiring additional resources or prioritization calls.

The project status report provides evidence of ongoing progress and completion of key activities, such as the deployment of new versions and bug fixes as listed under 'KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED' and 'LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS.' Furthermore, the 'EXECUTIVE SUMMARY' notes that discussions on the internal model with IT Management indicate sufficient internal capabilities. There are no mentions that additional staff are needed nor requests with unfulfilled resources, indicating that existing staff can deliver the work, thus meeting the criteria for a Green rating.

The EXECUTIVE SUMMARY states: 'Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.' This indicates that the support model is not yet established and is under discussion, therefore not fitting within an existing model, nor clear, which corresponds to a Red rating as per the criteria: 'Support model is unclear or assumes a continuous delivery (DevOps) model which doesn’t currently exist.'

The EXECUTIVE SUMMARY states: 'Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval,' indicating that a governance model is being discussed but not fully agreed. This suggests that the governance model is drafted but not yet fully aligned or agreed upon, thereby matching the criteria for an Amber rating.

The EXECUTIVE SUMMARY indicates collaboration between business and IT, mentioning 'negotiations with Kinaxis on licenses is near completion, work is in progress on the timeline and cost for the blueprinting, design & detailed planning phase' and 'IDT & Business cost estimates have been completed for the GIP.' However, there is no clear evidence of a strong past working relationship or that additional team building is unnecessary. This aligns with the Amber criteria, where business and IT have some experience or relationship together, but need further team building to improve the relationship.

        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---

Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. --- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---

This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

        - AMBER: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' in progress. Impacted portfolio approvals expected within 2 months. Tentative start date of IT effort known
        - RED: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' not yet prepared. Approvals not expected for >3 months. Start date of IT effort unknown

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

tasks_output.description:
Analyze the Project Status Report for project 'Downstream Exchange Product (DSX) (PRJ0016435)'  and evaluate its risk for the optic **firmness_of_opportunity**. **CRITERIA FOR firmness_of_opportunity:**
        - GREEN: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' prepared and all internal approvals obtained from all impacted portfolios. Start date of IT effort known
        - AMBER: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' in progress. Impacted portfolio approvals expected within 2 months. Tentative start date of IT effort known
        - RED: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' not yet prepared. Approvals not expected for >3 months. Start date of IT effort unknown

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

        - GREEN: Ready to mobilize - requirements for impacted portfolios are clearly defined and documented, e.g. in a Charter​​
        - AMBER: Additional requirements gathering needed in some portfolios in order to formally mobilize​​
        - RED: Inadequately defined requirements. 

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---

Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

tasks_output.description:
Analyze the Project Status Report for project 'Downstream Exchange Product (DSX) (PRJ0016435)'  and evaluate its risk for the optic **ts_and_broader_rds_it_resource_Capacity**. **CRITERIA FOR ts_and_broader_rds_it_resource_Capacity:**
        - GREEN: Resource discussion taken place and commitments obtained​​
        - AMBER: Request made, no firm commitments made​​
        - RED: Request made and no resources available and/or lack of required skills/capabilities ​​

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

Analyze the Project Status Report for project 'Downstream Exchange Product (DSX) (PRJ0016435)'  and evaluate its risk for the optic **owning_portfolio_it_resource_capacity​**. **CRITERIA FOR owning_portfolio_it_resource_capacity​:**
        - GREEN: Existing staff can deliver the work​​​
        - AMBER: Additional staff needed and/or a prioritisation call is needed​​
        - RED: Request made and no resources available and/or lack of required skills/capabilities ​​

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

Analyze the Project Status Report for project 'Downstream Exchange Product (DSX) (PRJ0016435)'  and evaluate its risk for the optic **effective_governance​**. **CRITERIA FOR effective_governance​:**
        - GREEN: Governance model defined and agreed across IT and Business stakeholders -AND- fully addresses the project scope and risk -AND-clear decision owner identified​
        - AMBER: Governance model drafted but not yet fully agreed -OR- drafted but does not match the project scope and risk​​​
        - RED: Governance model not yet drafted

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

--- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Negotiations with Kinaxis on licenses is near completion, work is in progress on the timeline and cost for the blueprinting, design & detailed planning phase.IDT & Business cost estimates have been completed for the GIP. IDT detailed design work on integration between Planning & Scheduling and source systems (GSAP, DEX, etc.) is on track. planned to complete end of Sep'25.​ Challenges & RTG Plans: Schedule (AMBER): DRB has asked to target end of July for GIP signoff, so that the contract with Kinaxis could be signed ASAP. GIP has been delayed by one month, revised date is now end of Aug. RTG: Planned dates are aligned with business stakeholders. Final signature is with Richard Jory.Cost (RED): $750k budget approved through to the end of July has been spent. RTG: Sandeep to request bridge funding of $250k cover until end of Sep'25 and GIP approval.Value (AMBER): GIP is in draft, IT costs and plans developed, busffiness still refining the actual value case, one month behind plan. RTG: Plan to complete and sign-off GIP by end of Aug, aligned with key business stakeholders.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: DRB has asked to target end of July for GIP signoff, so that the contract with Kinaxis could be signed ASAP. GIP has been delayed by one month, revised date is now end of Aug. RTG: Planned dates are aligned with business stakeholders. Final signature is with Richard Jory.

--- COMMENTS ON COST ---
Comments on Cost: $750k budget approved through to the end of July has been spent. RTG: Sandeep to request bridge funding of $250k cover until end of Sep'25 and GIP approval.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: Progress & Success: Negotiations with Kinaxis: DRB confirmed walk-away points. Negotiations ongoing and expected to complete by end of July.Progress: IDT Cost estimates are drafted and being reviewed by the IT LTs, planned to complete by end of 18th July. IDT detailed design work on integration between Planning & Scheduling and source systems (GSAP, DEX, etc.) is on track. planned to complete end of Sep'25.​ Challenges & RTG Plans: Schedule (AMBER): DRB has asked to target end of July for GIP signoff. This target date is at risk, because the commercial negotiation is taking longer than anticipated and GIP approval likely to go into Aug '25 as it needs Andrew Smith's approval.Cost (RED): $750k funding approved for the first 7 months of 2025 but initial stage will continue to the end of Q3, RTG: Sandeep to provide additional budget $250k cover until end of Sep'25 and GIP approval.Value (AMBER): 31 m$ / year level 1/level 2 Europe benefits were confirmed, down from 55 m$/year. RTG: Group Investment Proposal (GIP) to be developed and signed-off as soon as possible based on Europe business case

tasks_output.description:
Analyze the Project Status Report for project '2025 Planning and Scheduling IDT Work (PRJ4897790)'  and evaluate its risk for the optic **firmness_of_opportunity**. **CRITERIA FOR firmness_of_opportunity:**
        - GREEN: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' prepared and all internal approvals obtained from all impacted portfolios. Start date of IT effort known
        - AMBER: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' in progress. Impacted portfolio approvals expected within 2 months. Tentative start date of IT effort known
        - RED: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' not yet prepared. Approvals not expected for >3 months. Start date of IT effort unknown

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

Final signature is with Richard Jory.Cost (RED): $750k budget approved through to the end of July has been spent. --- COMMENTS ON COST ---
Comments on Cost: $750k budget approved through to the end of July has been spent. RTG: Sandeep to request bridge funding of $250k cover until end of Sep'25 and GIP approval.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: Progress & Success: Negotiations with Kinaxis: DRB confirmed walk-away points. Negotiations ongoing and expected to complete by end of July.Progress: IDT Cost estimates are drafted and being reviewed by the IT LTs, planned to complete by end of 18th July. IDT detailed design work on integration between Planning & Scheduling and source systems (GSAP, DEX, etc.) is on track. planned to complete end of Sep'25.​ Challenges & RTG Plans: Schedule (AMBER): DRB has asked to target end of July for GIP signoff. This target date is at risk, because the commercial negotiation is taking longer than anticipated and GIP approval likely to go into Aug '25 as it needs Andrew Smith's approval.Cost (RED): $750k funding approved for the first 7 months of 2025 but initial stage will continue to the end of Q3, RTG: Sandeep to provide additional budget $250k cover until end of Sep'25 and GIP approval.Value (AMBER): 31 m$ / year level 1/level 2 Europe benefits were confirmed, down from 55 m$/year. RTG: Group Investment Proposal (GIP) to be developed and signed-off as soon as possible based on Europe business case

tasks_output.description:
Analyze the Project Status Report for project '2025 Planning and Scheduling IDT Work (PRJ4897790)'  and evaluate its risk for the optic **estimate_budget_accuracy​**. **CRITERIA FOR estimate_budget_accuracy​:**
        - GREEN: Capacity or Scope-based estimate exists with +/- 20% level of confidence​​
        - AMBER: Capacity or Scope-based estimate exists with +/- 30% level of confidence.​​
        - RED: Planning number based on little science with +/- 50% level of confidence​​

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

        - GREEN: Governance model defined and agreed across IT and Business stakeholders -AND- fully addresses the project scope and risk -AND-clear decision owner identified​
        - AMBER: Governance model drafted but not yet fully agreed -OR- drafted but does not match the project scope and risk​​​
        - RED: Governance model not yet drafted

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

tasks_output.description:
Analyze the Project Status Report for project '2025 HVO B7 - LCF IDT (PRJ4872962)'  and evaluate its risk for the optic **firmness_of_opportunity**. **CRITERIA FOR firmness_of_opportunity:**
        - GREEN: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' prepared and all internal approvals obtained from all impacted portfolios. Start date of IT effort known
        - AMBER: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' in progress. Impacted portfolio approvals expected within 2 months. Tentative start date of IT effort known
        - RED: DAF / GIP or 'one pager' not yet prepared. Approvals not expected for >3 months. Start date of IT effort unknown

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---

These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
