Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

tasks_output.name:
Analyze the Project Status Report for project 'Downstream Exchange Product (DSX) (PRJ0016435)'  and evaluate its risk for the optic **ongoing_supportability_of_solution​​**. **CRITERIA FOR ongoing_supportability_of_solution​​:**
        - GREEN: Solution fits within an existing support model / contract , e.g. Accenture Managed Service (AMS)​​
        - AMBER: Solution will require amendments to an existing support model / contract (e.g. submission of an RFS) or a new support is in scope for delivery​​
        - RED: Support model is unclear or assumes a continuous delivery (DevOps) model which doesn’t currently exist​​​

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- COMMENTS ON SCHEDULE ---
Comments on Schedule: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept. RTG: Legal drafting a letter to reinstate ask, Graham to follow up with a F2F meeting with the exchange.

--- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

        **PROJECT STATUS REPORT TEXT:**
        --- EXECUTIVE SUMMARY ---
Executive Summary: Progress & Success: Externalisation: Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept; Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus, still planned to show by end of Aug the demo. Alternative customers identified for pilot if required.ICE Derived data license on the critical path PEN Test completed without any major or critical findings Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.Henry Hub onboarding onto DSX has begun, planned to complete testing by end of year with a go-live in H1 2026 Challenges & RTG: Schedule (Red): Externalisation: Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. --- GENERAL COMMENTS ---
Comments: n/a

--- KEY ACTIVITIES PLANNED ---
Key Activities Planned: 14th Aug - DSX v116, AES v5.9 & DSP v2.70 Release is scheduled for Production deployment on Thursday, 14th August. This release includes a set of new features, enhancements, and bug fixes, along with additional changes supporting the Externalization capability, which is targeted to go live later this quarter. 21st Aug - A Disaster Recovery (DR) capability proving exercise is scheduled for 21st August as part of our annual operational resilience strategy. This critical activity ensures our ability to recover services during major incidents, supports compliance requirements, and reinforces confidence in our failover and recovery capabilities. For this activity, the focus will be on proving DR capability for DSX, excluding other components (AES & DSP) from this exercise.

--- LAST MONTH ACHIEVEMENTS ---
Last Month Achievements: 8th July - Trading Technologies (TT) released an updated TTFIX.crt file, which contained the public certificates required for connectivity to TT’s FIX endpoint. These certificates are subject to annual renewal and must be updated to maintain uninterrupted service. TT recommended that the updated file be implemented prior to 11th July, as the existing certificates were due to expire on that date. The update was successfully applied to AES Production on Tuesday, 8th July at 8 PM UK. 17th July - Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production, transitioning from public internet to a secure VPN channel for enhanced reliability and security. 17th July - DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap. This release delivered new features and enhancements, and also included foundational changes supporting upcoming Externalization and FX Hedging capabilities, both scheduled to go live later this year.

optic_ratings.justification: The project status report mentions 'IDT & Business cost estimates have been completed for the GIP. ... GIP is in draft, IT costs and plans developed, business still refining the actual value case, one month behind plan. RTG: Plan to complete and sign-off GIP by end of Aug.' This indicates that the GIP is in progress and approvals are expected within a short-term period, matching the criteria for an Amber rating.

The project status report indicates that there is progress on the benefits case but no explicit confirmation of defined L1 and/or L2 benefits with agreed benefit owners. It states 'GIP is in draft, IT costs and plans developed, business still refining the actual value case, one month behind plan. RTG: Plan to complete and sign-off GIP by end of Aug, aligned with key business stakeholders.' This suggests the benefits case is in progress or needs revisiting, aligning with the Amber criteria.

The project status report does not directly address the requirements related to business requirements being clearly defined and documented. The report mainly discusses technical and scheduling aspects and lacks any mention of documented business requirements or readiness for mobilization. Therefore, based on the absence of evidence aligning with the criteria for Green or even Amber, the rating is Red because there is inadequate direct evidence of defined requirements.

The text mentions 'Technical & functional readiness on track for Sept' and challenges like 'Market Data Agreements may not be agreed with ICE exchange prior to go-live. Need agreement by end of Aug if we are to stick with the go-live end of Sept.' Additionally, the 'Pilot customer may not be able to participate as internal reorg is taking their focus,' which implies that more time/work is needed to define the solution completely. This aligns with the Amber criteria: Additional time/work needed to define solution.

The text includes a statement 'Cost (RED): $750k budget approved through to the end of July has been spent. RTG: Sandeep to request bridge funding of $250k cover until end of Sep'25 and GIP approval.' This indicates that the budgeting is based on less certainty, aligning with the criteria for a Red rating where planning is based on little science with +/- 50% level of confidence.

The project status report does not indicate any issues with staffing or required capabilities. There is no mention of needing additional staff or lacking required skills. The existing operations such as Henry Hub onboarding and deployment of DSX updates, as well as the planned releases and disaster recovery exercises, suggest that existing staff are handling the necessary work competently. This aligns with the criteria for a Green rating.

The project status report does not mention any specific resource discussions or commitments made. There is no evidence of resource availability or skill capabilities addressed in the text. Hence, the rating is Red as per the criteria: Request made and no resources available and/or lack of required skills/capabilities.

The project status report does not indicate any issues with staffing or a lack of required skills. There is no mention of a need for additional staff or prioritization calls related to staffing. The ongoing work such as the successful deployment of DSX updates and planned disaster recovery exercises suggests that existing staff can deliver the work. This aligns with the criteria for a Green rating.

The project status report does not indicate any issues with staffing or a shortage of required capabilities. There are no mentions of needing additional staff or prioritization calls for resource allocation. Existing operations, including releases and deployment activities, along with the planned disaster recovery exercises, imply that the existing staff is capable of delivering the work. This aligns with the criteria for a Green rating.

The project status report mentions 'Global Support Model: Internal model being discussed with the IT Management. Final step is to go to Owen O'Connell in Sept for approval.' This indicates that the support model is still under discussion and requires further approval, which aligns with the criteria for a Red rating where the support model is unclear or still being established.

The project status report does not provide any specific mention of a governance model being defined, drafted, or agreed upon with IT and Business stakeholders. There is no evidence of clear decision ownership or governance addressing project scope and risk. Hence, based on the criteria, the rating is Red: Governance model not yet drafted.

The project status report includes evidence of successful past collaboration between business and IT teams as indicated by achievements such as 'Successfully established and enabled AES-to-TT VPN connectivity in Production' and 'DSX v115, AES v5.8 & DSP v2.69 were successfully deployed to Production, marking a key milestone in our strategic roadmap.' These milestones suggest that the business and IT teams have delivered projects together successfully in the past and have a strong working relationship.
